reasoning: Nontraumatic subdural hematoma (spontaneous SDH) occurs primarily in elderly patients on anticoagulation or with coagulopathies. Estimated incidence ~5-10 per 100k person-years in general population, higher in elderly (>65 years). Uses incidence metric for acute neurological event.
source: Ducruet AF et al. (2012). Epidemiology, clinical presentation, and prognosis of acute subdural hematoma. Neurosurg Clin N Am. 23(2):137-147
